content:
1
ITEM NO.19               COURT NO.12               SECTION II-C
               S U P R E M E  C O U R T  O F  I N D I A
                       RECORD OF PROCEEDINGS
Petition(s) for Special Leave to Appeal (Crl.)  No(s).  9480/2025
[Arising out of impugned final judgment and order dated  08-05-2025
in MCRCA No. 671/2025 passed by the High Court of Chhatisgarh at 
Bilaspur]
NAMIT KOSARIA                                      Petitioner(s)
                                VERSUS
STATE OF CHHATTISGARH                              Respondent(s)
FOR ADMISSION 
IA No. 150709/2025 - EXEMPTION FROM FILING O.T.
IA No. 150708/2025 - PERMISSION TO FILE ADDITIONAL 
DOCUMENTS/FACTS/ANNEXURES
 
Date : 07-07-2025 This matter was called on for hearing today.
CORAM :  HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE PANKAJ MITHAL
         HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE K.V. VISWANATHAN
[PARTIAL COURT WORKING DAYS BENCH]
For Petitioner(s)  Mr. Raghent Basant, Sr. Adv.
                   Mr. Sidhartha Shukla, Adv.
                   Mr. Lzafeer Ahmad B. F., AOR
                   Mr. Anurag Dayal Srivastava, Adv.
                   Mr. Sachin Naryan Dubey, Adv.
                   Mr. Kaushtaki Sharma, Adv.                   
                   
For Respondent(s)  Mr. Abhinav Shrivastava, AOR
                   Ms. Unnati Vaibhav, Adv.
                   Mr. Vikas Pandey, Adv.                   
                   
          UPON hearing the counsel the Court made the following
                             O R D E R
1. On the oral request of the learned counsel for the petitioner,
the  complainant  is  directed  to  be  impleaded  as  one  of  the
respondents.
2. Amended cause title be filed within two weeks.
3. Issue  notice  to  the  newly  impleaded  party  respondent,2
returnable within six weeks.
4. Mr. Abhinav Shrivastava, learned counsel,  appears on caveat
and accepts notice on behalf of the  complainant. Hence, formal
notice to the said respondent is dispensed with.
5. In the meantime,  no coercive action shall be taken against
the petitioner, in pursuance to FIR No.431/2025, dated 18.04.2025,
registered  at  Police  Station-Civil  Lines,  District,  Bilaspur,
Chhattisgarh.                            
6. In the meantime, learned counsel for the respondent may file
response/reply, if so desired.
(VARSHA MENDIRATTA)                             (NIDHI MATHUR)
COURT MASTER (SH)                             COURT MASTER (NSH)
